page.title: 07Bird Ringing (Brockhampton)
page.content: As your walk begins in The Woodland Walk,you will see bird{nesting boxes on many of the trees.These are tended by a local doctor.A few years ago Dr. D.Boddington took me with him to show me how he put the rings on the baby birds so that he can see they return another year.To do this he took all the baby birds out of the nest boxes and put them into a little pouch and one by one he took the little birds out and said "Show me a leg" and then he put a ring on with a number and re- corded in his little book and put the bird back into his little box. In the wood ,you expect to see many kinds of birds.The most common seem to be{wood pigeon,rooks}and{crows}in the larger bird. {Wood peckers }are not seen but once a {great spotted wood {pecker }came to our bird table for food.
